alert.note: Alert for Bakersfield; Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Caruthers - San Joaquin - Selma; Delano-Wasco-Shafter; Fresno-Clovis; Hanford - Corcoran - Lemoore; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Merced - Madera - Mendota; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; South End San Joaquin Valley; Southeast San Joaquin Valley; Visalia - Porterville - Reedley; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 21 at 12:08AM PST until February 25 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A FREEZE WATCH IS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Low temperatures 29 to 33 degrees in most of the San Joaquin Valley Tuesday night. Low temperatures 27 to 31 degrees in the majority of the San Joaquin Valley Wednesday night. Low temperatures 28 to 32 degrees in most of the San Joaquin Valley Thursday night. * WHERE...The San Joaquin Valley. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive vegetation. Frost and freeze conditions may damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes, they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly.
